ARABIC: لَّا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: but gives no shade or protection from the flames,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Neither shady nor protecting against the blazing Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: which neither provides (cooling) shade nor protection against the flames;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: which neither gives shade nor protects one from the flames.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Which neither gives shade, nor saves from the flame.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Neither shady nor of any use against the fierce flame of the Fire."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Neither having the coolness of the shade nor availing against the flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (Which yet is) no relief nor shelter from the flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: affording neither shade, nor protection from the flames,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Neither shading nor availing against the flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: neither shady nor of any avail against the flames.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Which yields) no shade of coolness, and is of no use against the fierce Blaze.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Neither shading, nor of any use against the fierce flame of the Fire."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: wherein there is neither shade, nor freeing from the blazing flames
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Offering no shade, and unavailing against the flames.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [77:31] which is neither shady, [neither] protective, [unable] to shade them from the heat of that Day, nor of any avail against, [nor] wards off from them anything of, the flame, the Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((Which yet is) no relief) from the heat of the Fire (nor shelter from the flame) of the Fire.
